Module app
Package app.GUI

Class GUIutil

java.lang.Object
app.GUI.GUIutil
public class GUIutil extends Object
GUIutil.java Singleton to provide spawning methods of javafx objects to avoid boilerplate implementations in each page's controllers
Since:
07/05/2021
Author:
Dario Loi
See Also:
app.controllers

  • Method Details

    • pingCreationMenu

      public static void pingCreationMenu​(Double x, Double y, javafx.scene.layout.Pane parent, String[] items, javafx.event.EventHandler[] actions) throws IllegalArgumentsException
      Positions the context menu abd prompts the user with generic options provided in the function's arguments the Strings and the corresponding events must be paired at the same index in the two arrays.
      Parameters:
      x - X to position at
      y - Y to position at
      parent - The parent pane upon which to ping the contextMenu
      items - An array of strings to be displayed as menuitems on the contextMenu
      actions - An array of EventHandlers to be attached to each menuitems on the contextmenu
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentsException
      See Also:
      Obj, Arrow

    • ButtonMenu

      @Deprecated public static void ButtonMenu​(double X, double Y, String[] items, javafx.event.EventHandler[] actions, javafx.scene.layout.Pane parent)
      Deprecated.
      Wrapper method for spawnCreationMenu, provides an automatic implementation of the ugly button trick utilized to pop a ContextMenu on a scrollPane so that I do not have to look at it directly when implementing it (sorry for the boilerplate, still friends? <3) WARNING: the button trick is not necessary anymore, one can instantiate the contextMenu and then call the show method on a parent object to cleanly display it without need for such voodoo tricks, therefore this method is deprecated.
      Parameters:
      X - Double, the X coordinate at which to spawn the menu at
      Y - Double, the Y coordinate at which to spawn the menu at
      items - Array of Strings, contains all the different text options to be displayed on the menu
      actions - Array of Eventhandlers, contains all the different actions to be performed by the option
      parent - Any child of class Pane, provides a parent upon which to attach the button to do the ugly trick
      See Also:
      ContextMenu, Pane

    • spawnPrompt

      public static javafx.scene.control.TextInputDialog spawnPrompt​(String msg, String Title)
      Utility method to spawn a prompt (TextInputDialog), the prompts acts as an interrupt, waiting for the input to be provided before resuming the program's execution
      Parameters:
      msg - a String to be displayed as a message to the user
      Title - a String to be used as the prompt window's title
      Returns:
      the String inserted by the user
      See Also:
      TextInputDialog

    • spawnMultiPrompt

      public static javafx.scene.control.Dialog<ArrayList<String>> spawnMultiPrompt​(String[] msgs, String Title)
      Spawns a prompt for multiple user inputs
      Parameters:
      msgs - Array of strings, each of which will generate an input textfield to prompt the user for input
      Title - String, Title of the dialog
      Returns:

    • computeAngle

      public static double computeAngle​(javafx.scene.Node A, javafx.scene.Node B)
      Wrapper for the usual arctan method to compute the angle between two objects
      Parameters:
      A - The source Object
      B - The target Object
      Returns:
      a Double alpha, between -pi and pi, representing the angle between A and B

    • updateInspectObj

      public static void updateInspectObj​(ObjectGUI obj, javafx.scene.control.TextField NameField, javafx.scene.control.TextField XField, javafx.scene.control.TextField YField, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> combogg, javafx.scene.control.TextField spaceText)
      Updates the inspector to show an ObjGUI object, loading all it's parameters in the corresponding graphical components
      Parameters:
      obj - the ObjGUI to load
      NameField - TextField containing the name of the Object
      XField - The X position of the object in the graphical pane
      YField - The Y position of the object in the graphical pane
      combogg - ComboBox containing all the spaces and subspaces of the object
      See Also:
      ObjectGUI, Obj

    • updateInspectArr

      public static void updateInspectArr​(ArrGUI arr, javafx.scene.control.TextField NameField, javafx.scene.control.TextField SourceField, javafx.scene.control.TextField TargetField, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton Endo, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton Epi, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton Mono, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton Iso, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton Auto, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> combor, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> comboi, Category category)
      Updates the inspector to show an arrow object, loading all it's parameters in the corresponding graphical components
      Parameters:
      arr - The arrow to load
      NameField - TextField containing the name of the arrow
      SourceField - TextField containing the source object of the arrow
      TargetField - TextField containing the target object of the arrow
      Epi - RadioButton, true if the arrow is an epimorphism
      Iso - RadioButton, true if the arrow is an isomorphism
      Mono - RadioButton, true if the arrow is a monomorphism
      combor - ComboBox, contains all the range subspaces of the arrow
      comboi - ComboBox, contains all the images of the arrow
      See Also:
      ArrGUI, Arrow
